pages.text: Now that you have a little bit more beexperience under your belt, you should look into a better way to house bees.$(br2)The Mellarium is an industrially-sized apiary, capable of housing special modules that can kick your production into high gear.

The Mellarium provides a baseline 1.25x multiplier to productivity which can be increased through modules.$(br2)It is also important to note that $(l)non-base mellarium blocks can not be placed in the top layer$() of the Mellarium.
Try not to build these across chunk borders, or right next to each other.

pages.title: Frame Housings
pages.text: Frame Housings can hold frames based on their tier - the basic can hold one, the regular two, and the large three. These frames will stack multiplicatively.

pages.title: Mutator
pages.text: Consumes one catalyst every time a queen dies to increase the chance of it producing mutated offspring - check your recipe browser for possible catalysts.

pages.title: Temperature Unit
pages.text: Every bee lifecycle tick, has a chance to consume specific items to increase or decrease the temperature of the Mellarium - check your recipe browser for possible fuels.

pages.title: Hydroregulator
pages.text: Every bee lifecycle tick, has a chance to consume specific items to increase or decrease the humidity of the Mellarium, with a chance of producing a leftover - check your recipe browser.

pages.title: Rain Shield
pages.text: Using the power of a heart of the sea, protects bees from inclement weather.
